body:
1. This isn't a joke, [they've done it before to me simply because of my political views](https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/63wm/rcp-update-concerning-the-mass-siege). (They're Jewish). 

2. Members leaving is the point, especially certain members they don't like. They don't need members, they don't want members. It's a money laundering scheme, and their clique is on the take. Why do you think every announcement is made only after they decided to implement it without feedback from the users first? [Their own coders left in protest](https://ruqqus.com/+RuqES/post/6c5g/ruqes-update-0280-new-ruqqie-reaction). 

3. They banned a guy they didn't like, **who wasn't even posting or commenting**. It was a temp ban changed to a permanent ban with frivolous claims and zero transparency. How are we to know that's actually the case? They act like this is just a joke, but if it is - it's at the expense of the rest of their content producers and only a small minority benefit. What other site can you say you've seen acts this way? Not even reddit had admins this arrogant.
body_html:
1. This isn't a joke, they've done it before to me simply because of my political views. (They're Jewish).

  2. Members leaving is the point, especially certain members they don't like. They don't need members, they don't want members. It's a money laundering scheme, and their clique is on the take. Why do you think every announcement is made only after they decided to implement it without feedback from the users first? Their own coders left in protest.

  3. They banned a guy they didn't like, who wasn't even posting or commenting. It was a temp ban changed to a permanent ban with frivolous claims and zero transparency. How are we to know that's actually the case? They act like this is just a joke, but if it is - it's at the expense of the rest of their content producers and only a small minority benefit. What other site can you say you've seen acts this way? Not even reddit had admins this arrogant.
